reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night as just a flying visit however, if we're down this way again we would certainly go back. An extremely friendly welcome and everything you could want from a b&b...
reviews.title: very very good

reviews.text: This is a very nice B&B to stay at. The rooms are very clean and a good size. The bathroom is typical size of most B&Bs. The beds are quite comfortable to sleep. The views aren't the best, but you are looking at country side. It's a bit of a walk, about 10 minutes to get to Blarney Castle, but the town is nice to walk through. The owners are very sweet and helpful. They can provide information about the sites, driving directions, and excellent places to eat. The owners are also very good cooks because breakfast was delicious!
reviews.title: Nice Place, Good Food

reviews.text: Our family had and awesome stay at the Blarney Vale B&B. I agree with all other posters that Ann was genuinely the friendliest B&B owner we had the pleasure of visiting. And, that's saying much, for we were blessed at all our B&Bs. It is a short walk to Blarney town center. Ann's breakfasts were wonderful, cheerily served; and our family room was neat, clean and comfy. We would certainly return on another trip. You will NOT be disappointed. Most highly recommended.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B choice in Blarney.

likes.liked: — Ann's friendliness and marvelous breakfast, nearness to Town Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I are in our 20s and found this place to be an absolute treasure! Anne's hospitality was what made this B&B the best place we stayed during our 8 day stay all over Ireland. Anne was so nice and even took us down in to town to let our legs do some resting after the walk around Blarney castle. She is by far the nicest B&B owner we have run in to in Ireland. Breakfast was great and the room was awesome! Take it from me, if you want a good place to stay in walking distance from the city and not a really long drive from some great cities and islands, this is the place to stay. My girlfriend still misses staying at Anne's.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Blarney!!

reviews.text: Blarney Vale House is a beautiful b&b with lovely, clean rooms. Anne, the owner, was friendly and helpful with whatever we needed. Breakfast was delicious - especially the pancakes! It is conveniently located near the Blarney village. Staying here was a wonderful experience; we would highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Blarney Vale is a beautiful b&b

likes.liked: — clean, nicely decorated rooms, friendly hostess, great breakfast

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: We booked here because family had stayed here before us and had very nice comments. We were not disappointed. The room was perfect and the whole family made us feel welcome. Ann had lots of good information for us, making our time there very enjoyable.
No need to look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Nice time at a nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cozy and clean rooms, a great breakfast - an own menue card! - and a very friendly and helpfull hostess. We had a nice stay.
reviews.title: Warm and friendly B+B

reviews.text: Greetings from Germany
reviews.title: One of my favorites!

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at this B+B near Blarney Castle; also very convenient to Cork and Midleton (Jameson distillery). Ann Hennessy is an extremely friendly, warm proprietor who cares greatly about her guests. The rooms are bright and clean and offer sufficient space to rest after a busy day. Ann offers a variety of breakfast choices; her full Irish breakfast is delicious. Slightly larger or more plush towels would be a nice addition, but this B+B offers a great value in a very quiet location.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Blarney Vale Bed and Breakfast is beautifully done out and offered a very warm and genuine welcome from Anne and her son. The B&B has large rooms, ensuites, and very comfortable beds and don't miss the amazing breakfasts cooked by Anne - they're superb! It is a very short stroll into the centre of the village which offers some lovely restaurants, and entertainment, but the B&B itself is set far enough back from the road to be peaceful. I have to say that this was by far one of the warmest welcomes and most helpful B&B's we stayed at during our trip. Thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night at the Blarney Vale B&B but it was a fine place to stay. Well located (about an 8 minute walk to the town green and Castle area) and quiet. We were able to get pancakes for breakfast, which was a nice break since most B&Bs we stayed at only had different variations on eggs! Innkeepers were nice but we didn't interact with them much.
reviews.title: Nice B&B well located close to Blarney Castle and village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two full weeks travelling all through Ireland. The Blarney Vale House was one of the few places we stayed for more than one night. Out of the many different Bed and Breakfasts we stayed in, this was the BEST. It had the most extensive menu and really offered a lot for everyone. It was an easy walk to the Blarney Castle and the town was adorable. I fell in love with Blarney Woolen Mills and the Muskery Pub. Ann was always willing to give us her opinion and help us with directions or just ideas of what to do! I wish all my experiences could have been like this one! It is a MUST stay if you are even remotely close to the area.
reviews.title: Fabulous Vaca!

reviews.text: Anne Hennessey, the owner, was very sweet and welcoming. We only stayed one night, but this home is very pretty, and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable. It is very near town and you can walk on sidewalks to get there in about 5 minutes. The Muskerry Arms pub was very good too.
reviews.title: Blarney Vale is a pretty home located in walking distance of the castle.

reviews.text: We stayed at this B & B for two nights May 17th - 19th, 2009 and we absolutely loved it!
reviews.title: Best Bed and Breakfast in Blarney!! (travel agent review)

reviews.text: Loved this B.& B. !! Super warm friendly people !! Large clean pretty rooms Comfortable beds!! Yummy breakfasts!! Best pancakes I've ever had!!! Anne was extremely helpful helping us plan our day Restaurants, Places to see Etc... Anyone near Blarney should try this B&B!! 2 thumbs up!!! We Used plublic transportation this whole trip and Blarneyvale was within walking distance to Blarney Castle the Blarney woolen Mills, Lots of restaurants, pubs, shopping and really close to bus stop to catch a bus to Cork City!! Also very good price not expensive at all!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful,Warm friendly,Had a absolute super time!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Blarney Vale B&B and had a delightful time. The owners are lovely people, the physical facilities are absolutely first cabin and the food was marvelous. We cannot recommend this B&B highly enough.
reviews.title: Completely Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: A beautiful place to stay. The rooms were huge, clean, and well maintained. A nice walk into the center of Blarney. The owner was very helpful on where to go and by what time we needed to be there. If you ever stay in Blarney, this is the place.
reviews.title: A Gem of a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This would have to be the best B&B I've stayed in so far. My husband and I stayed at Blarney Vale for 3 nights on a trip around Ireland and really loved this B&B. The double room was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious with an excellent selection (my husband loved the 'Blarney Vale Special'!). The Blarney villiage square was a nice 5-10mins walk and has plenty of restaurants/bars to choose from. Blarney castle is a 'must' and is only 10mins walk away from Blarney Vale B&B. Anne was most very helpful in advising us on places to visit and we enjoyed a great day trip to nearby Cobh and Kinsale.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.text: I highly recommend this B&B. There's lots to see and do in the area. I only wish I could've stayed longer!
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay with the Family, only 5 min walk from Blarney Village

likes.disliked: — The weather - but not much they could have done about that!
